firstEpisode.mdesc: Watch the first episode of Yu-Gi-Oh!

parts.content: Mickey-Laugh.webp
Woah...
That was awesome!!!
The intro theme, the Blue-Eyes White Dragon, all of it! It was so awesome!
YU-GI-OH!!!
Mickey-Smile.webp
Haha! Sorry! But wasn't Yugi's transformation so cool?!?!?!
Kaiba totally got what he deserved!
And did you see that Pegasus guy's eye at the end? It was the same as what shows up on transformed Yugi's forehead!
Oh man I can't wait for the next episode!
Man I wish Yu-Gi-Oh! was real! Those monsters are sick!
Oh, get this. So my dad said a friend of his works for a company in Japan called Konami, and he heard that Yu-Gi-Oh actually has a real Yu-Gi-Oh! card game!
And get this, he said its going to be coming to the U.S. as well!
Mickey-Grimmace.webp
I have an idea! Let's become the best duelists in the world once we get actual cards to play with!
If we start saving up our allowances now, we will be able to get as many Yu-Gi-Oh! cards as we want!
What do you say? You wanna be rivals?
Mickey-Blush.webp
You will!? Awesome! I can't wait. In the meantime, let's make sure we don't miss a single episode so we know all the best strategies when the cards come out!
YuGiOh_Vol1_DVD.webp

The "Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters" anime first aired in the United States on September 29, 2001 on the Kids' WB Television network, translated to English by 4Kids Entertainment. The animated series would see massive success with a young American audience and air weekly until its conclusion on June 10, 2006.
LOB.webp
The success of the animated series would lead to a number of sequel animated series and merchandise releases, including the Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game.
The Yu-Gi-oh! Trading Card Game (TCG) first released to the United States with the Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon booster pack product on March 8, 2002.
SDYK.webp
The Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon would be supplemented by the Yugi and Kaiba starter decks only a few weeks later on March 29, 2002.
gameDDSFM.webp
Additionally, between these two foundational products, two video games would release including promotional cards.
YugiKaibaFormat.webp
Collectively, the cardpool produced by these product releases established the first commonly recognized era of competitive Yu-G-Oh! TCG play - appropriately named the Yugi-Kaiba Format.
Mickey-Laugh.webp
C'mon, c'mon! The game shop is supposed to have the Yu-Gi-Oh! cards today!
SolomonMuto.webp
Ho-oh!
Welcome to the Local Game Store!
I'm the owner, Solomon. But you can just call me Gramps.
Solomon Muto (Gramps)
Here we supply different tabletop game products, including board games, role playing games, and trading card games.
So, what brings you in today?
Mickey-Laugh.webp
We want to buy some Yu-Gi-Oh! cards!
SolomonMuto.webp
Ho-oh! Yu-Gi-Oh! cards eh? Well, you're in luck, we just started carrying them.
(Man, these things have been flying off the shelves.)
Well, if you want to be Yu-Gi-Oh! players, then I should let you know...

We just started hosting local game nights for Yu-Gi-Oh! Once a week, you can duel against your fellow local duelists. Participating will earn you an exclusive Tournament Pack, but play well and you may even earn greater prizes!
I'd be happy to waive your entry fee as its our first night. It won't be free next time though. We have to pay for the prizes somehow.
Ho-oh!
You're in no rush, so go ahead and pick out the packs you want to buy and build your decks for tonight!
wallet.webp

To simulate growing up with Yu-Gi-Oh! and game-ify the experience, you will be given an allowance each month. You can exchange money acquired through your allowance to purchase Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG products each month.
To start you off, here is $120 (USD). You can exchange this for a whole booster box. Use that to build your first deck!
BanditKeith-Smile.webp
Hey, it looks like our first game will be against eachother!
Don't think I'm taking it easy on you! I'm gonna win this!
After your first night at the LGS, you and your friend retire and conclude your first week as duelists.
Be on the look out for new products each week.
Also, don't neglect to visit other locations around town. Each location will have a combination of random and static events to engage with!
Going forward, you will receive an allowance of $30 each week. Spend it immediately to bolster your collection or save it up for future opportunities - the choice is yours.
Keep in mind the hearts at the bottom right of the screen - those are your "lives."
You will lose a life every time you lose to your rival.
If you run out of lives - it's Game Over; you retire as a duelist.
With that said, Good Luck and Have Fun as you progress through the history of the Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG!
TP1-2.webp
You get to open 3 tournament packs!
